title: Xax video
content:
So a long time ago I posted some shots of a Fribbulus Xax world I made. It turns out I also made a video flythrough that looked kind of cool but I never posted it. There's a few problems I'd like to fix, but I can't be bothered and it still looks sweet, so check it out.

[url=http://spatang.com/images/fx.avi]spatang.com/images/fx.avi[/url][url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

content:

Looks really cool. I never knew you were a modeler. As in 3D not... magazine shoot... modeler...

You know what I meant...-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Xax video
content:
The framerate is too fast compared to the amount of frames, making the animation look too fast. So yeah, framerate could have been lowered with no problems here...____________

title: Re: Xax video
content:
It requires a codec to play.

Please do tell me which one, I can't istall it otherwise.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Xax video
content:
Wow that is pretty good - it looks very faithful to the game. It would've been nicer if the movement was slower though - 24fps is fine but the movement is so quick you can't really appreciate all the detail involved [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Mine played it back with the "ffodivx" codec, so DivX should be fine. Hex editing the AVI shows the codec is DX50, so you might need a newer version of DivX. Or you could try changing the AVI from DX50 to DIVX and see if the version you already have will play it...

title: XAX!!!
content:
Aaah, so incredibly classy. Very nice work keeping the cartoony look in a 3D world. I hope you still have the original models backed up somewhere, as they will probably come in handy one day.

I agree about the speed. Things whiz by too quickly (though if you step-through gradually it helps), and it would be nice to see some other details close up, but it's an applaudable prod nonetheless.

title: Re: XAX!!!
content:
That's pretty cool.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: XAX!!!
content:
for the next movie you could use windows media encoder to create WMVs. they are quite well compressed without destroying the picture and the format doesn't need any hightech codec to work.

neat video though, i only miss Korath III somewhere in it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img]

title: Nice!
content:
Ah, good work xtra, I was happy to see this video. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Nice!
content:
I hereby promote VLC as well. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I used it for some more-alien-codec-using-movies with success, after numerous people from numerous internet communities kept suggesting people to try it.
After my recent Windows reinstall (actually upgrade to XP) I decided I wouldn't even install a software DVD-player, see if I could make do with just VLC.
So far so good; I needed to get used to some different key combinations (which can be changed), but it requires less resources, so some really high res movies don't stutter as much as with other players, and not having to download some akward codecs for a lone movie every now and again is very nice.
Also it's free.
Actually I didn't try an actual DVD yet, but that'll probably work as well.

As for the Xax movie... can't download now, but I will when I'm back home!Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Video
content:
Man, my 3d-phobia is so terrible, I froze up as the rocket blasted off, since I could read where the skybox of stars created a corner far down below... then I jumped when the camera whipped around and nearly got swallowed by the Bloog Control Center.

What a terrifyingly cool video.
